newsitem.title: USA: US corporate bonds end up, WCI Steel jumps.
newsitem.headline: US corporate bonds end up, WCI Steel jumps.

text.p: U.S. high-grade corporate debt shadowed U.S. Treasuries' steady climb to close up, while junk-rated WCI Steel Inc bonds gained five points on news its main shareholder may take it private, dealers said.
WCI Steel paper closed at a 109 bid, 110 offer after the firm said late Tuesday that 84 percent shareholder The Renco Group was considering making an offer to take the firm private.
If Renco decided to make an offer, it would do so within the next two weeks, depending on market conditions, WCI said.

Overall, the junk bond market closed up 1/8 to 1/4, dealers said, with key gainers in the telecommunication sector for a second straight session as the previously underperforming paper strengthened its apparent turnaround.

Nextel Communication's zero coupon senior discount notes due 2003 closed up 1/2 of a point at 73-1/4 bid, 74 offer. The notes gained more than one point on Tuesday to end at a 72-3/4 bid. Nextel's new notes due 2004 gained a point at 64-1/4 bid, 64-3/4 offer on Wednesday.
One part was for $100 million in senior notes priced at 99.642 to yield 7.361 percent or 71 basis points over the 5.75 percent Treasury due 2003.
The second part was for $25 million in senior notes at 99.694 to yield 7.544 percent or an 83 basis point spread.
Both issues carry a make whole call at the greater of par or Treasury plus 25 basis points and are rated Baa1/BBB-plus.
In the high-grade secondary market, ATT Corp debt was inactive after spreads widened slightly on Tuesday following news the firm's third-quarter profit would fall below expectations.
In the governments market, the benchmark 30-year bond closed up 23/32 at 97-24/32 to yield 6.93 percent. The Dow Jones Industrial Average finished up 3.33 at 5877.36.
